title: Bug 38131 - ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using ajc without the -d option, ajc creates a directory named "subpackage" under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using ajc without the -d option, the compiled class file should be placed in the same directory as the source file.
SR: Create a class in a subpackage. Use the ajc command to compile the class without specifying the -d option. Verify that the compiled class file is placed in the same directory as the source file.
